text: To top it all, tonight's Devotional seemed to have summarized the points I covered with this friend. As someone created in God's Image and Likeness, we deserve the Love that comes into our lives. And we too have the capacity to create Love based on our own being. https://t.co/UHXoaxNVo0

author: Marc Rovy (윤재민)
text: to be assigned as a guardian angel to one person alone. And it is through my breaking that the Light within me could shine through onto others. It is humbling to know that in my vulnerability people find shelter and comfort. In my loss, people always gain the answers they need.

author: Marc Rovy (윤재민)
text: experiences of unrequited love and rejection. This is not to take credit, but it feels really comforting to know that God uses me to lead people to their next destination. This is not a first for me, but still, it never fails to amaze me. Today I was reminded that I wasn't meant

author: Marc Rovy (윤재민)

author: Marc Rovy (윤재민)
text: P.S. I forgot to mention na may ganito na palang eksena. Spotted ka bui. 😅 Kahapon lang ito. Nonetheless, I am thankful for the love and attention. And I hope to be able to continue showing my truest self and share love with all the purest intentions. https://t.co/sY1wQNtvIA

author: Marc Rovy (윤재민)
text: While this post focuses more on the physical, I can attest that my core oozes of love. I don't have to fake interaction or interest. I am genuinely inclined to shine the light and love I have so much inside. I am not a celebrity, nor am I planning to be. I just know, I am "me." https://t.co/pObY3GQ48O

author: Marc Rovy (윤재민)
text: No filter. No photoshop. Just the "raw" me. I don't have to fake anything to be liked. Not my age, height, body nor weight. Wala akong abs, guys. Lol. Don't get me wrong ah, I am not complaining. In fact, I am beyond thankful--that in my truest form, people can actually like me. https://t.co/2jwyPoiyZu

author: Marc Rovy (윤재민)
text: or hanging out with friends. Yung unang sulyap is excusable but the succeeding ones, I know, are intentional. I don't know if it has always been like this even before the pandemic, but it feels good to be seen--even when I think this isn't yet the best version of myself possible.

author: Marc Rovy (윤재민)
text: Since we got back to the office, I've been hearing people say that I look good in pics to begin with but didn't expect I'd look even better in person. Considering I gained a lot of weight during the pandemic, it was surprising to hear not just good but great things about myself. https://t.co/NwKq6hNu8M
